大家好，我系一個P牌仔，看見香港的局勢而看見大家對法律上的認知範圍不太多，但希望我的小小法律知識，能夠幫助到大家和希望大家幫我廣傳出去。

1-香港法律有一樣野名稱-合法拘捕
意思系警員在拘捕示威者過程中到底有沒有遵守合法的拘捕權力

例如: 當速龍小隊在大量示威者離開的時候，只要警察身上沒有委任證和number，上到法庭的時候，只要大律師一問到合法拘捕時，手足正常程序下便不能被控告。

2- 被捉到的手足如果在拘捕過程中受到不恰當的武力對待或任何酷刑方式對待，手足必須站出來， 找出拘捕你的警察或接受口供的警察，所謂的Arresting officer，警察必定會受到法律制裁。

replies.msg:
我都試試!

英文翻譯 English Translation

Thoughts of a 15 year old frontline protestor (male)
“I’d rather it happen to me, than for it to happen to you!”

Q1 What is the general feeling on the frontline? Is everyone anxiously searching for “undercover cops”?

No, we’re feeling the same as before. Those on the frontline know which decisions are good, and which decisions are bad. We would gather together, twenty to thirty of us, and we would vote to decide our actions. We are not very afraid of the rumours in the field.


Q2 What are the effects of being hit by tear gas and rubber bullets?

Tear gas is very painful – it’s like being on fire – and afterwards my urine is red when I pee, not sure if that is related. Rubber bullets is also very painful, with the swelling taking one week to fade away.


Q3 Do your parents blame you, and forbid you to go protesting?

I don’t think my dad knows, while my mom is very open-minded. She doesn’t really say much, though she did laugh at where I got shot (the butt).


Q4 How do you view the rumour, that some people are protesting because they are receiving money?

Getting shot in the eye is going to affect your whole life. Just think about it – no amount of money can motivate you to do that.


Q5 What makes you willing to gamble your future, to do something with little chance of success?

Liberate Hong Kong, Revolution of our Times.


Q6 Would you be discouraged if fewer people attend today’s rally [on 18 August 2019]?

A little, but I do understand that some people are tired, and everyone is already putting in their best effort. I’d carry on for their part.


Q7 Do you think the continual escalation on the protest frontline would give pressure to the government? Do you think the escalation is useful?

If there is still no response, then the protests would naturally escalate, and there would be some pressure on the government.

I can’t say if this will bring any actual results, I’m just doing the best I can.


Q8 Are you afraid of getting shot by the police?

I’m not afraid at all, “if we burn, you burn with us”. It’d be better if I got shot instead of the girls, as a girl’s facial appearance is very important. It’d be better if it happened to me, than to someone else.


Q9 Do you usually go protesting by yourself?

No, I go protesting with my friends. We’d still get separated after the police takes action, as we’d all have to move quickly, and cannot care to much. Later on I formed teams with other protestors; and actually I feel that those with gear are rarely “undercover cops”.


Q10 What are you feelings right now?

Very helpless, I don’t understand why the government isn’t responding to us. I feel useless, not being able to achieve anything, and it feels like there isn’t any hope despite our efforts.


Q11 What do you want to do the most, right now?

I want to grow up quicker, so that I may try some alcohol, try things that I have not done before, I’d like to have a girlfriend!
15 歲
多謝你，真正年輕有為
以我觀察 年齡唔代表一切 好多前線手足 體能上同心理上都未足夠 喺一個充滿危機嘅地方佢地無選擇去博命跑（荃灣到荔景）另外喺無喺短時間內作一個決策 記得你考慮多一分鐘 自己處景會更危險 同埋比時間克警好圍捕

咁型!! 想有女朋友應該唔難!

到時贏咗，全個連登都想同你飲杯慶祝!

香港人加油! 光復香港! 時代革命!!
多謝你地

Q4 How do you view the rumour, that some people are protesting because they are receiving money?

Getting shot in the eye is going to affect your whole life. Just think about it – no amount of money can motivate you to do that.

If there is still no response, then the protests would naturally escalate, and there would be some pressure on the government.

I can’t say if this will bring any actual results, I’m just doing the best I can.


Q8 Are you afraid of getting shot by the police?

I’m not afraid at all, “if we burn, you burn with us”. It’d be better if I got shot instead of the girls, as a girl’s facial appearance is very important. It’d be better if it happened to me, than to someone else.
